revised_title: Thermo-Chemistry of Flame Spectra at High Temperatures
tldr: This article discusses the author's observations and experiments on the flame spectra of various alkali and alkaline earth metal salts at high temperatures. The author examines the continuous and banded spectra of lithium, sodium, potassium, rubidium, and cesium salts, as well as the spectra of calcium, strontium, and barium compounds. The study highlights the differences in the spectra of these elements and the importance of the salts' purity and volatility in their thermo-chemical decomposition.
